com.facebook.buck.core.build.distributed.synchronization.impl

Class NoOpRemoteBuildRuleCompletionWaiter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.buck.core.build.distributed.synchronization.impl.NoOpRemoteBuildRuleCompletionWaiter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RemoteBuildRuleCompletionWaiter

    public class NoOpRemoteBuildRuleCompletionWaiter
extends Object
implements RemoteBuildRuleCompletionWaiter
    Use this implementation when running a standalone Buck build without Stampede

    • Method Detail

      • shouldWaitForRemoteCompletionOfBuildRule

        public boolean shouldWaitForRemoteCompletionOfBuildRule(String buildTarget)
        Description copied from interface: RemoteBuildRuleCompletionWaiter
        Local Buck builds will never wait for remote completion of rule before building locally. Stampede builds always wait if local_mode = WAIT_FOR_REMOTE, and will also wait if set to false but the build rule has already started building remotely.
        Specified by:
        shouldWaitForRemoteCompletionOfBuildRule in interface RemoteBuildRuleCompletionWaiter
        Returns:

      • waitForBuildRuleToAppearInCache

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<CacheResult> waitForBuildRuleToAppearInCache(BuildRule buildRule,
                                                                                                       Supplier<com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<CacheResult>> cacheCheck)
        Description copied from interface: RemoteBuildRuleCompletionWaiter
        When performing a remote/distributed build, Future will get set once the given build target has finished building remotely and the cacheCheck no longer returns a miss (tested with a limited number of backoffs). For a non-remote build build, this operation is a no-op and the Future will return immediately.
        Specified by:
        waitForBuildRuleToAppearInCache in interface RemoteBuildRuleCompletionWaiter
        Returns:
        Future with result supplied by final cacheCheck (further chaining with direct executor will use the thread that finished the execution of cacheCheck) or future with CacheResult.ignored() if the operation is a no-op.

      • waitForMostBuildRulesToFinishRemotely

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Boolean> waitForMostBuildRulesToFinishRemotely()
        Specified by:
        waitForMostBuildRulesToFinishRemotely in interface RemoteBuildRuleCompletionWaiter
        Returns:
        Future that will complete when most build rules have finished remotely. Value indicates whether most rules finished successfully or in a failure.
